titles.title: Temporary Employee Placement Assistance Act

To authorize noncompetitive, career or career-conditional appointments for temporary and term employees of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, including those assigned to the Resolution Trust Corporation, who are separated due to downsizing and office closures or due to the termination of the Resolution Trust Corporation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 9/23/1994--Introduced. Temporary Employee Placement Assistance Act - Provides that certain employees of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and/or the Resolution Trust Corporation who are facing unemployment due to downsizing or office closures may be appointed noncompetitively, under a career or career-conditional appointment, to a position in the competitive service.
